intro: Polygonum sagittatum var. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent arrowhead, is a perennial herb native to North America. It is characterized by its distinctive arrowhead-shaped leaves, which are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it the "pubescens" designation. The plant typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist to wet soil conditions. Its flowering stems rise above the foliage, bearing clusters of small, reddish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. This species is often used in wetland restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife.
